poem:
The Gift

A jet gleams  
Qatar's gift airborne,  
whispers of power  
beneath the cloudless  
veil of law.  
Pages sealed,  
but the sky  
remembers whispers,  
a trail of  
whitened truths,  
a freedom waiting,  
caught  
in flight's embrace,  
mute in the  
haze of luxury.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump justice department sued over legal memo on Qatar’s luxury jet gift The US Department of Justice is facing a federal lawsuit for refusing to release a legal memorandum that reportedly cleared the way for Donald Trump’s acceptance of a $400m luxury aircraft from Qatar’s government. The Freedom of the Press Foundation, represented by the watchdog group American Oversight, filed the Freedom of Information Act (Foia) lawsuit in Washington DC’s federal district court after the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
